intro: Campyloneurum solutum, commonly known as the golden moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and vibrant yellow-green coloration. The plant features small, ovate leaves that are often covered in a layer of translucent, waxy material. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest floors or on rocky substrates. Campyloneurum solutum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecosystem.
